intro: Aphanomyrtus alata, commonly known as the silver wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the south-western region of Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, pinnately compound leaves that have a silvery-white underside. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often during the warmer months. Aphanomyrtus alata is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
